data.title: An Interview with Christopher Eccleston
data.text:
‘We’re standing on the earth Dickens stood on, and where he imagined this character, Ebenezer, tramping these streets. So it’s in the earth‘

We sat down with Emmy Award-winner Christopher Eccleston to talk first experiences of Scrooge, performing at The Old Vic, and life lessons from Charles Dickens.

Catch Christopher on our stage playing the miserly Southwark money-lender in our five-time Tony Award-winning production of A Christmas Carol, along with spectacular live carols, glowing lanterns and warm mince pies.

A Christmas Carol – The Home of Dickens

Born in 1812, Charles Dickens pre-dates The Old Vic by just six years. Sitting at the heart of Lambeth and Southwark, our theatre spent its formative years as the backdrop to the smog and spirit of Dickensian London which has been immortalised in Dickens’ novels – and none more so than A Christmas Carol, which returns to its Lambeth and Southwark home this Christmas to transport us back over 170 years to where it all began.
